result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joe D Amaya was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 65 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Blood draw costs to be paid to Waukesha Circuit Court and will be forwarded to Waukesha Co. Sheriff's Dept. (To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.)
All other Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Pay surcharge.
Count 2 was dismissed outright.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attend Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe D Amaya

defendant.name: Amaya, Joe D
defendant.address: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joe D Amaya in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Sam Wegleitner, supervised by Mary Brejcha, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  Credit for 65 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
email correspondence from the jail regarding trustee status with attached letter

NO HUBER BAILEE STATUS. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program including random urine screens.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring immediately upon release from custody.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.

Defendant Joe D Amaya not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled at 12:01.  Court reads email from jail regarding her order for trustee status.  Court vacates order for trustee status.  Court grants motion to modify bail.  Court orders cash bail modified to $4,999.00.  Clerk to send copy of communication from jail with attached letter to both counsel.

Defendant Joe D Amaya in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to modify bail.  Defendant was told that he needed to reduce his bail to obtain trustee status in the jail. Court will not modify bail at this time as jail administration has said that the amount of bail does not exclude a defendant from trustee status.  Court orders defendant to have trustee status in the jail.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail.

Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:15 am.
